decks.notes: The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Force of Negation while putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures like Emperor of Bones and Overlord of the Balemurk. It also includes cards that provide card advantage and tempo advantage such as Consign to Memory and Ephemerate. The mana base is built to support the deck's color requirements and the overall strategy is to control the game while chipping away at the opponent's life total.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Birthing Ritual and Coiling Oracle, allowing for early plays of powerful creatures like Abhorrent Oculus and Ice-Fang Coatl. With a mix of disruption spells like Subtlety and Dismember, as well as counter spells like Flare of Denial and Force of Negation, the deck aims to control the board while establishing a strong aggressive presence. The inclusion of cards like Harbinger of the Seas and Shardless Agent adds versatility to the strategy, making it difficult for opponents to predict and counter the deck's moves.

This deck aims to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Crumbling Vestige, while also utilizing Amulet of Vigor to untap lands and accelerate. Primeval Titan is a key card that can search for lands like Gruul Turf or Simic Growth Chamber to further ramp up mana. The deck's ultimate goal is to play cards like Scapeshift or Green Sun's Zenith to tutor for key pieces like Lotus Field or Malevolent Rumble to set up a devastating combo turn that can quickly overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to control the game through counterspells and removal spells while using card advantage and card selection tools to stay ahead of the opponent. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy, protect its own key threats like Narset and Teferi, and eventually win the game through incremental advantage and powerful finishers like Solitude and Hall of Storm Giants. The deck utilizes a mix of efficient removal, counterspells, and card draw to outvalue the opponent and grind out a victory in the late game.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a variety of aggressive creatures and powerful spells that can control the board. The deck focuses on efficient creature plays like Territorial Kavu and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, while also utilizing Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding to strengthen its board presence. Consign to Memory provides additional control options, while Lightning Bolt offers direct damage to opponent creatures or the opponent themselves. The deck aims to establish dominance early in the game and maintain pressure throughout.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategies while maintaining a strong aggressive presence with a variety of creatures and removal spells. It aims to control the board using cards like Prismatic Ending and Ephemerate, while deploying threats like White Orchid Phantom and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to pressure the opponent. By combining disruptive elements with powerful creatures, this deck aims to outvalue and overwhelm the opponent in a fast-paced game, ultimately achieving victory through a combination of disruption and aggression.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly and efficiently using cards like Pyretic Ritual, Manamorphose, and Ruby Medallion. The deck aims to cast various spells and combo pieces like Ral, Monsoon Mage, and Past in Flames to generate a storm count and deal lethal damage with cards like Grapeshot. The deck also includes card draw and manipulation spells to help find combo pieces quickly and maintain consistency in executing the combo. The end goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful storm turn and win the game in a single explosive sequence.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Power Plant, Tower, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It utilizes control elements such as Thought-Knot Seer and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Karn, the Great Creator acts as a versatile threat and utility card. The deck also includes powerful Eldrazi creatures and removal spells to control the board and close out the game. The main win condition is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and disruption while using the UrzaTron lands to fuel the game plan.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly ramp up your mana using cards like Amulet of Vigor and Arboreal Grazer in order to cast Primeval Titan and search for powerful lands like Gruul Turf and Urza's Saga. Once you have your lands in place, you can use cards like Scapeshift to search for specific combo pieces and win conditions. The deck also includes control elements like Boseiju, Who Endures to protect your combo pieces and disruption spells like Malevolent Rumble to disrupt your opponent's game plan. Ultimately, the goal is to assemble your combo pieces and overwhelm your opponent with powerful threats.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo involving the Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan to generate mana and search for powerful lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures. The strategy also includes cards like Scapeshift and Gruul Turf to quickly ramp into the combo while using cards like Malevolent Rumble and Simic Growth Chamber to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The key strategy is to efficiently utilize land drops and creature abilities to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a massive board presence and powerful combo finish.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. By utilizing powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer, as well as spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. The inclusion of Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory provides additional support and buffs for your creatures. Utilizing a mix of lands and artifacts, the deck also has some control elements with cards like Goblin Bombardment and Arena of Glory.

The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes a combination of multicolored creatures and spells to maximize damage output and control the board. The key strategy involves establishing a strong board presence early on with efficient creatures like Territorial Kavu and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, while using Leyline Binding and Tribal Flames to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, the deck includes potent finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to close out games quickly. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and outpace the opponent in a fast-paced Modern format.

The deck focuses on utilizing various lands and spells to quickly ramp up mana production, allowing for powerful plays with Primeval Titan and Amulet of Vigor. By using cards like Gruul Turf and Lotus Field, the deck can generate abundant mana to search for key pieces such as Urza's Saga and Vesuva. The goal is to efficiently combo off, deploying strong threats like Hanweir Battlements and Boseiju, Who Endures, while also controlling the board with Malevolent Rumble and Arboreal Grazer. The deck strives to overwhelm opponents with its explosive ramp and combo potential.

This deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay, utilizing cards that provide direct damage and quick creature deployment. The key strategy involves using cheap spells like Lava Dart and Lightning Bolt to control the board while boosting the power of creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Slickshot Show-Off. The deck also includes cards like Mishra's Bauble and Scalding Tarn to help with card selection and mana fixing. By maintaining pressure and quickly overwhelming opponents, this UR Aggro deck aims to end the game swiftly before the opponent can stabilize.

This combo deck focuses on using cards like Lotus Bloom and Whir of Invention to quickly assemble a powerful board state without the need for lands. The key strategy involves generating mana through alternate means and using cards like Thundertrap Trainer and Goblin Charbelcher to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. The inclusion of counterspells like Disrupting Shoal and Spell Snare helps protect the combo pieces, while cards like Fallaji Archaeologist and Hydroelectric Specimen provide additional value and control options. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently execute its game plan and overwhelm the opponent with a lethal combo.

This deck focuses on utilizing lands and untap effects to ramp up quickly and efficiently, allowing you to play powerful threats like Primeval Titan and Spelunking early on. The key strategy is to assemble the Amulet of Vigor combo with bounce lands like Simic Growth Chamber to generate massive amounts of mana and overwhelm your opponent with big creatures and game-winning combos like Scapeshift. By carefully sequencing your plays and managing your resources, you can outpace your opponent and secure victory with explosive plays.
